intro: Derris elegans var. elegans, commonly known as the elegant derris, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Fabaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its compound leaves and distinctive yellow flowers. The plant produces pods that contain seeds, which are often used in traditional medicine. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological and medicinal contexts.
